intro: Sebastiania chiapensis, commonly known as the Chiapanese beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bright red berries that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are small and inconspicuous. The berries are an important food source for various birds and mammals in its native habitat.
